titleStmt.title: A discourse of divine providence I. In general: that there is a providence exercised by God in the world. II. In particular: how all Gods providences in the world, are in order to the good of his people. By the late learned divine Stephen Charnock, B.D. sometime fellow of New-Colledg in Oxon.
Treatise of divine providence
titleStmt.author: Charnock, Stephen, 1628-1680.

titleStmt.title: A discourse of divine providence I. In general: that there is a providence exercised by God in the world. II. In particular: how all Gods providences in the world, are in order to the good of his people. By the late learned divine Stephen Charnock, B.D. sometime fellow of New-Colledg in Oxon.
Treatise of divine providence
titleStmt.author: Charnock, Stephen, 1628-1680.
Adams, Richard, 1626?-1698.
Veel, Edward, 1632?-1708.

publicationStmt.publisher: printed by R. Roberts for Thomas Cockerill, at the Three Legs in the Poultrey, near the Stocks-Market,

notesStmt.note: Originally published in 1680 as: A treatise of divine providence (Wing C3712).
"To the reader" signed: Richard Adams. Edward Veal.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library, Washington, D.C.
